verses.text: ¶ [a]Why are times not laid up by the Almighty? And why do not they that know him see his days?

footnotes.a: Or, Why is it, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, That they who know him see not his days?

verses.text:
There are that remove the landmarks;
    They violently take away flocks, and feed them.

They drive away the ass of the fatherless;
    They take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
They turn the needy out of the way: The [b]poor of the earth all hide themselves.
They cut [d]their provender in the field; And they glean the vintage of the wicked.

They lie all night naked without clothing,
    And have no covering in the cold.

They are wet with the showers of the mountains,
    And embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
There are that pluck the fatherless from the breast, And [e]take a pledge of the poor;

footnotes.e: Or, take in pledge that which is on the poor

verses.text:
they go about naked without clothing,
    And being hungry they carry the sheaves.

They make oil within the walls of these men;
    They tread  winepresses, and suffer thirst.
From out of the [f]populous city men groan, And the soul of the wounded crieth out: Yet God regardeth not the folly.
The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, Saying, No eye shall see me: And he [g]disguiseth his face.

footnotes.g: Or, putteth a covering on his face

footnotes.h: Or, Which they had marked for themselves

verses.text: For [i]the morning is to all of them as thick darkness; For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.

footnotes.i: Or, thick darkness is to all of them as the morning; For they etc.

footnotes.j: Or, Ye say, Swiftly etc. Hebrew Swift is he etc.

verses.text: Drought and heat [k]consume the snow waters: Sheol have sinned.

footnotes.l: Or, as a tree; even he that devoureth etc.

verses.text:
He devoureth the barren that beareth not,
    And doeth not good to the widow.

Yet  preserveth the mighty by his power:
    He riseth up that hath no assurance of life.
giveth them to be in security, and they rest thereon; [m]And his eyes are upon their ways.

And if it be not so now, who will prove me a liar,
    And make my speech nothing worth?
